uav.generic.util

Class UtilGeo

  • java.lang.Object
    • uav.generic.util.UtilGeo

  • public class UtilGeo
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with useful methods on transformations between Cartesian and geographical coordinates.
    Since:
    version 1.0.0

      • parseToGeo

        public static java.lang.String parseToGeo(PointGeo base,
                                          double x,
                                          double y,
                                          double h,
                                          java.lang.String separator)
        Converts Cartesian coordinates to geographical coordinates
        Parameters:
        base - the point base to conversion
        x - the x value to convert
        y - the y value to convert
        h - the height to convert
        separator - the type of separator
        Returns:
        the string with value: lat + separator + lon + separator + alt
        Since:
        version 1.0.0

        Returns:

      • parseToGeo2

        public static java.lang.String parseToGeo2(PointGeo base,
                                           double x,
                                           double y,
                                           double h)
        Converts Cartesian coordinates to geographical coordinates
        Parameters:
        base - the point base to conversion
        x - the x value to convert
        y - the y value to convert
        h - the height to convert
        Returns:
        the string with value: lat + "\t" + lon + "\t" + alt
        Since:
        version 1.0.0

      • parseToGeo3

        public static java.lang.String parseToGeo3(PointGeo base,
                                           double x,
                                           double y)
        Converts Cartesian coordinates to geographical coordinates
        Parameters:
        base - the point base to conversion
        x - the x value to convert
        y - the y value to convert
        Returns:
        the string with value: lon + "," + lat + ",0 "
        Since:
        version 1.0.0
